function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code currently stores user data in a dictionary in memory. This means that if the server is restarted, all user data will be lost. A better approach would be to store user data in a database. This would allow data to persist across server restarts and also provide better performance and scalability.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The JWT token generated in the login route is being decoded before being returned in the response. However, the token should be returned as is without decoding. The client will use the same token for authentication in subsequent requests and the server will decode it then. So, the token should not be decoded before being sent in the response.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The current implementation of the login route does not handle the case where the user is not found in the users dictionary. While the code does check if the username is in the users dictionary, it does not return a meaningful error message if the user is not found. It would be more user-friendly to return a message such as "User not found" in this case.
